subject: RE: [junit] your opinion needed: package for unit testing codes
msgSnippet: When I first started using JUnit (which is very recent) I built my folders using a src main and src test directory structure. That way I could put the test
messageBody:
When I first started using JUnit (which is very recent) I built my folders using a \src\main and src\test directory structure. That way I could put the test code into the same packages, but use Ant to strip it out of the final build. I do the same with the documentation that I generate. We use Javadocs to generate internal documentation only, ant runs the javadoc but doesn't include that into the released jar.
Our drive to remove the code was two-fold. (1) To keep the jar as small as possible because we are sometimes pushing this code over 33.6k lines to rather out of the way places. (2) Word from the mountain was that test code and javadocs are considered internal code only and could not be included in the final customer jars.


Chip
